data.text: Wild Boars: Another Dangerous Animal for Campers
I hear alot of talk about dogs and bears information. But what if you are camping and biking through wild boar territory. In my part of the world they have been known to attack people. Just curious.

I grew up in the northern Italian countryside and wild Boars are very common (I even have a video on my insta showing a wild boar inside my garden). However, I have never heard of any accident related to them. I myself have come in contact with these animals rather often and, as it's the case with basically any other wild creature, you won't get in trouble as long as you are not actively disturbing them. They can get aggressive if you cross them or take them by surprise and they are with their young ones (protective mothers). But generally speaking, they will try to avoid you. It can get scary camping in the woods surrounded by boars, because they are very active at night and you will definitely know they are close. But yeah, it's not but deal. Unless maybe you are referring to some particular wild boar I don't know about. Cheers
